conclusion: To find the magnitude and direction of the resultant Ampere force acting on the trapezoidal frame.
Identify the lengths of each segment: AB = L, BC = L, CD = L, AD = 2L.
Calculate the resistance of each segment: R = ρL/S.
Total resistance of the frame: R_total = 6ρL/5S.
Calculate the current in the frame using Ohm's Law: I = 5SE/6ρL.
Force on a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field is given by F = ILB sin θ.
Calculate the force on each segment: F_AB = F_CD = 5SEB√3/12ρ, F_BC = 5SEB/6ρ, F_AD = 5SEB/3ρ.
Determine the horizontal components of forces: F_AB,x = F_CD,x = 5SEB√3/24ρ.
Determine the direction of the resultant force using tan θ = F_total,y / F_total,x.
